articles.headline: Toyota’s President Softens on Speaking to Congress
articles.snippet: Akio Toyoda, president of Toyota Motor, appears almost eager to share information about car recalls.
articles.abstract: Akio Toyoda, president of Toyota Motor, appears almost eager to share information about car recalls.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  Any company looks to its chief executive for leadership, especially in a time of crisis.

articles.headline: Buzzing, Tweeting and Carping
articles.snippet: Google offers a new tool that out-Twitters Twitter when it comes to sending and receiving messages. Is there a catch? You bet your Buzz there is.
articles.abstract: Google offers a new tool that out-Twitters Twitter when it comes to sending and receiving messages. Is there a catch? You bet your Buzz there is.
articles.lead_paragraph: Funny, isn’t it? The people who review gadgets generally aren’t the people who buy them.

articles.headline: Snipers Imperil U.S.-Led Forces in Afghan Offensive
articles.snippet: The Taliban’s familiar display of haphazard and ineffective shooting has been punctuated by the work of what would seem to be well-trained marksmen.
articles.abstract: The Taliban’s familiar display of haphazard and ineffective shooting has been punctuated by the work of what would seem to be well-trained marksmen.
articles.lead_paragraph: MARJA, Afghanistan  In five days of fighting, the Taliban have shown a side not often seen in nearly a decade of American military action in Afghanistan: the use of snipers, both working alone and integrated into guerrilla-style ambushes.

articles.headline: Turning Patents Into ‘Invention Capital’
articles.snippet: Intellectual Ventures has acquired 30,000 patents and has so far collected more than $1 billion in license fees.
articles.abstract: Intellectual Ventures has acquired 30,000 patents and has so far collected more than $1 billion in license fees.
articles.lead_paragraph: BELLEVUE, Wash.  Nathan Myhrvold wants to shake up the marketplace for ideas. His mission and the activities of the company he heads, Intellectual Ventures, a secretive $5 billion investment firm that has scooped up 30,000 patents, inspire admiration and angst.

articles.headline: R.B.S.’s Shining Star in Connecticut
articles.snippet: The Royal Bank of Scotland, which may be one of Britain’s most bailed-out banks, has a gleaming new $500 million U.S. headquarters.
articles.abstract: The Royal Bank of Scotland, which may be one of Britain’s most bailed-out banks, has a gleaming new $500 million U.S. headquarters.
articles.lead_paragraph: STAMFORD, Conn.  The Royal Bank of Scotland may be one of Britain’s most bailed-out banks. But at its American headquarters here, there is hardly a whisper of distress.

articles.headline: Navigating the Shifting Tax Landscape
articles.snippet: Retirement accounts, charitable gifts and taxes faced by retirees on Medicare are all in dispute on Capitol Hill.
articles.abstract: Retirement accounts, charitable gifts and taxes faced by retirees on Medicare are all in dispute on Capitol Hill.
articles.lead_paragraph: THIS is the year of tax uncertainty, and what might seem like temporary tax benefits could turn into tax traps.

articles.headline: Broker? Adviser? And What’s the Difference?
articles.snippet: The difference between a broker and an adviser is not always black and white, and in the end investors must look out for themselves.
articles.abstract: The difference between a broker and an adviser is not always black and white, and in the end investors must look out for themselves.
articles.lead_paragraph: THE Great Recession has intensified a long-running debate: who is better able to look out for your money, a broker or an independent adviser?

articles.headline: U.S. Cracks Down on ‘Contractors’ as a Tax Dodge
articles.snippet: Federal and state officials are pursuing firms that try to pass off regular employees as independent contractors.
articles.abstract: Federal and state officials are pursuing firms that try to pass off regular employees as independent contractors.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal and state officials, many facing record budget deficits, are starting to aggressively pursue companies that try to pass off regular employees as independent contractors.

articles.headline: Retirees Trade Work for Rent at Cash-Poor Parks
articles.snippet: An itinerant army of retirees is realizing dreams of life on the road in a way that benefits struggling state and national parks.
articles.abstract: An itinerant army of retirees is realizing dreams of life on the road in a way that benefits struggling state and national parks.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROMA, Tex. — A cold wind whipped down the Texas plains on the night last month that Sharon Smith, 68, and her husband, Bill, 73, arrived here to be work-campers.

articles.headline: Agreement Is Near on New Overseer of Banking Risks
articles.snippet: The White House and Senate are nearing agreement on forming a council, led by the Treasury secretary, to identify systemic risk to the financial system.
articles.abstract: The White House and Senate are nearing agreement on forming a council, led by the Treasury secretary, to identify systemic risk to the financial system.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Senate and the Obama administration are nearing agreement on forming a council of regulators, led by the Treasury secretary, to identify systemic risk to the nation’s financial system, officials said Wednesday.

articles.headline: Walgreen to Buy Duane Reade for $618 Million
articles.snippet: Walgreen will greatly expand its presence in New York City with a deal that is expected to close by August.
articles.abstract: Walgreen will greatly expand its presence in New York City with a deal that is expected to close by August.
articles.lead_paragraph: Walgreen may already be the nation’s biggest drugstore chain, but its $618 million purchase of Duane Reade will put it on seemingly every Manhattan street corner.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Profit Rises at Wal-Mart, but Outlook Is Clouded
articles.snippet: The retail giant forecast earnings for the current quarter that could miss Wall Street estimates.
articles.abstract: The retail giant forecast earnings for the current quarter that could miss Wall Street estimates.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart, the giant retail discount chain, posted a record profit on Thursday for the fourth quarter, which included the all-important holiday shopping season.
